Clipping BoxTops is an easy way for your family to help raise funds for our school. BoxTops are each worth 10¢ and they quickly add up to real cash for our school.

To help reach or goal we need each family to participate. You can participate by carefully cutting around the dotted line of your boxtops and placing 25 of them in a Ziploc bag with a piece of paper that has your child’s name, grade, and AM/PM. Have your student bring the Ziploc bag to their teacher or the front office.

Each semester your student’s name will be put in a drawing once for every 25 boxtops you have sent in and your family will have the chance to win a $25 gift card to Cinemark theaters.

Our fall submission deadline is approaching fast. Please have all of your BoxTops in by Friday, October 25th.

Also, please check out the new BoxTops App.

Thanks for your help!

A TRULY REMARKABLE PROJECT

Recently, Mrs. Raphael’s sixth grade group read “Sadako and the Thousand Cranes”. So moved by the story of the stricken little girl and her journey to create as many origami cranes as possible, our sixth grade embarked on their endeavor to construct cranes of their own. Enthusiasm grew and the group reached their goal of creating 1006 origami cranes (a couple of them HUGE). Following display here at school, sixth grade cranes will be sent to The Children’s Peace Monument in Hiroshima Japan and Chaparral Star Academy will be forever remembered for their contribution in the International Paper Crane Database. This project speaks to the dedication of staff and students and their pursuit of world peace.

January 31, 2016 at 9:25 AM ·

CSA Speech & Debate took its first school trophy this past Saturday! The Sharks placed 3rd in Sweepstakes with a host of other accomplishments, including:

-- Elise Little: Tournament Champion in Dramatic Interpretation, 2nd Place in Poetry, 4th Place in Prose
-- Julia Craciun: Tournament Champion in Poetry, 6th Place in Duo Interpretation (w/ Redding), Semifinalist in Prose
-- Hanna Herbowy: Tournament Champion in Original Oratory, 5th Place in Domestic Extemp.
-- Cameron Eagle: Tournament Champion in Prose
-- Olivia Herrera: 3rd Place in Duo Interpretation (w/ Gaona), Semifinalist in Prose
-- Ruby Gaona: 3rd Place in Duo Interpretation (w/ Herrera), Semifinalist in Poetry
-- Sariah Redding: 6th Place in Duo Interpretation (w/ Craciun), Semifinalist in Poetry
-- Emilce Trinidad-Escobar: 4th Place in Dramatic Interpretation
-- Oliver Fairbanks: 5th Place in Prose
-- Hanzala Siddiqui: 7th Place in Domestic Extemp.
